Description:

DST is seeking experienced OBIEE+ consultants who are willing to travel in the Northeast Region (CT, NY, NJ, PA and DE). Applicants must have a minimum of 3 years hands on experience working with Oracle Hyperion Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) or OBIEE reporting tools and a minimum of 5 years of progressive IT project experience. Previous finance experience is helpful.

Responsibilities:

The consultant may work alone, as part of a DST team or as part of a client managed project team to implement OBIEE+ reporting solutions as a stand-alone project or as part of Hyperion Planning, HFM or Essbase based solutions across many different industries and will help DST clients to maximize the return on their technology investments. Specific responsibilities include:

Gathering and analyzing business requirements
Participating in determining standards and best practices as related to financial reporting and analysis
Designing and implementing reporting solutions involving a variety of source
Tuning and optimizing existing OBIEE reports
End user training and knowledge transfer to the client support teams

Required Technical Skills/Experience:

At least 3 years of OBIEE+ implementation experience
Overall 5 yrs+ IT experience
At least 2 years+ consulting experience preferred
Demonstrated capability to architect, design and build all aspects of a Hyperion Reports, Web Analysis, Interactive Reports, or Answers implementation including creating and managing reports, web grids, and multiple data sources
Demonstrated capability to successfully integrate the OBIEE EPM products with Oracle and other third party data sources and applications
Solid understanding of relational database concepts and ability to work with Oracle PL/SQL and/or Microsoft T-SQL
Solid understanding of Microsoft Windows Server and Unix operating systems

Other Requirements:

Solid understanding and experience with one or more structured software project lifecycle methodologies
Ability to understand and document business requirements
Experience in data quality issues and ability to investigate and resolve data validation issues
Strong command of the English language
Ability to interface with clients at all levels within an organization
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to provide input into project plans including defining tasks and estimating level of effort
Ability to prioritize and work independently
Ability to identify project risks and determine when escalation of issues is necessary
Excellent time management skills and ability to track and report time accurately and timely
Readiness to travel if need (travelling 3-4 days a week, home on weekends) preferred

Company Name: Achieve Beyond Pediatric Therapy & Autism Services
Job Description:
Come join a team of passionate therapists providing excellent pediatric therapy to children throughout the United States! Achieve Beyond was founded in 1995 and is continuously growing to meet the needs of developmentally disabled children through our ABA, speech, occupational, and physical therapy. We currently offer our SLP services in the entire metro New York area (including the five boroughs of NYC, Hudson Valley and Long Island) and Albany, New Jersey, Connecticut, California (greater Los Angeles area, the greater San Francisco area, San Diego, and Orange County), Minnesota, Delaware, and the Virginia/ Maryland/ DC area. We specialize in conducting initial evaluations and providing ongoing services in home, community and clinic settings. Achieve Beyond is centered around our culture of collaboration and support to ensure our services are of the highest quality and adhere to our strong ethical standards.

All of our clinicians will have access to the following benefits:

Training and use of our paperless billing and data collection system
Full practice management we take care of intake, staffing, billing, tracking authorizations, insurance correspondence and maintenance of your certifications, so you are able to focus on providing our children with the best services!
Access to continuing education workshops and trainings (we are an ASHA and BACB ACE provider)
Team-building meetings, events, and trainings

Now Hiring: Fee For Service, Hourly Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)

LOCATION: Positions available throughout New Haven, Fairfield, Middlesex & Southern Hartford/Litchfield areas

JOBRESPONSIBILITIES:

Conduct assessments for children diagnosed with ASD and work with caregivers to create meaningful goals and treatment plans
Design behavior intervention plans
Create functional specific, observable, and measurable goals for behavior therapists and caregivers to implement.
Provide at least 10% direct supervision of behavioral therapists assigned to cases, incorporating behavioral skills training and specific performance feedback while ensuring clinical integrity of the programs.
Clinically review session notes on a regular basis for assigned behavior therapists
Analyze data and implement data-driven program changes
Ensure that progress is generalized and caregivers are active participants in therapy through specific goals, training sessions, and communication.
Conduct reassessments at least twice per year while summarizing data and progress for each client supervised
Regular communication with parents, behavioral therapists, and the Achieve Beyond office is required
Maintain confidentiality of information regarding children and families (in accordance with HIPAA and State & Federal regulations).
Ensure that all programs are socially significant, functional, and lead to independence and happiness!(services, programs, schedule, staff, etc.)

REQUIREMENTS:

Must have a passion for ABA and working with children, families, and therapists!

Master's Degree in (Behavior Analysis, Special Education, Educational/Health/Human Services, Psychology).
BCBA and LBA REQUIRED
Minimum of one year of ABA client/teacher field supervision
Must be self-motivated, a team player, and exercise patience/professionalism.
Excellent organizational skills with attention to detail.

Physical Requirements:

Must be able to travel to and from assigned cases including but not limited to driving personal vehicle, walking, and/or use of public transportation such as a bus or train.
The ability to climb and descend staircases
The ability to lift 10 pounds regularly
The ability to sit on the floor, kneel, and/ or crawl for extended periods

Compensation depends on experience and will be discussed during the interview process.

Job Title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) or Licensed Clinical Social Worker
Job Description:
Job Description

Position Title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst/Clinician

Reports to Director: The Clinician will report to their designated Clinical Supervisor/Director of Fun 2B Free, LLC on an as-needed basis based on case requirements.

EDUCATION, CREDENTIALS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

The Clinician must hold 1 or more of the following:

· BCBA certification and Connecticut Behavior Analyst license must be in good standing.

· Licensed Clinical Social Worker within good standing.

Clinician must have at least 2 years’ experience doing in-home supports or Center Based, with knowledge of insurance-based services and writing and overseeing ABA programs. The ideal candidate will be familiar with standardized assessments (e.g., ABLLS-R, VB-Mapp, AFLS, Vineland, etc.), have experience working with significant behavioral and emotional challenges, complex trauma and working within a multidisciplinary team. We typically serve ages 3-14 year olds.

POSITION SUMMARY & FUNCTIONS:

The Clinician conducts Functional Behavior Assessments, writing subsequent behavior plans, skill acquisition programs utilizing community membership, social and relationship integration as the primary focus to make socially significant change and striving towards happiness and independence. Our mission is to deliver therapy that is FUN, creative & exciting with capture the whimsical essence of life! F2BF challenges traditional therapy service delivery models & industry norms that focus on disabilities & problem behaviors. We value our clients as contributable and meaningful members of our community. We will never view your child disable, incapable or broken & our support of children and young adults with a diagnosis is outcome based and data driven. Quality of life, enrichment enjoyment and happiness are the treatment vehicles to improving problem behaviors and skills deficits that limit the pursuit of happiness and meaning in one’s life.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Fun 2B Free takes a non-traditional approach to our behavioral practices and we recognized that our children are part of a larger family unit and Clinicians will be tasked with supporting multiple factors that contribute to the child’s success.

General:

· Provide 1:1 Applied Behavioral Analysis services to clients

· Supervise RBTs and Behavior Therapists

· Precisely follow procedures and instructions, both written and spoken

· Follow documentation procedures with accuracy

· Complete CEU requirements as dictated by the BACB

· Complete or verify completion of schedule in current scheduling platform

· Maintain the highest standard of ethics, including confidentiality

· Complete credentialing requirements identified by funding sources

· Protect the health and safety of clients and fellow employees by reporting all Critical Incidents, potential risks and following all health and safety procedures.

· Follow all company policies as laid out in the Employee Handbook and other policy documentation.

· Complete additional duties as assigned by Supervisor or Director

Case Management:

· Conduct FBA/PFA assessments using indirect and direct methods

· Conduct skils-based assessments including but not limited to: ABLLS-R, VB-MAPP, AFLS, PEAK

· Create behavior intervention plans and skills-based programming for each client

· Continually analyze data and adapt each client’s individual plan as needed

· Develop Treatment plans and progress reports for all clients on caseload

· Train staff on implementation of each client’s individual plan

· Case manages clients (25 hours Observation and Direction weekly, 5 hours Parent Training Weekly, 10 hours report writing, programmatic updates, data review, staff training, PPT meetings weekly

· Oversee session notes and provide feedback on an ongoing basis for all staff working with caseload of clients

· Collaborate with other service providers to promote coordination of care

· Develop and conduct parent training using the basis of “The Power of Positive Parenting” through an ABA lens;

Clinician:

· Communicate with parents regarding clinical progress and/or concerns

· Knowledge and use of billable insurance codes related to client treatment

· Complete any additional duties as assigned by leadership team

· Attend scheduled clinical meetings with the Clinical Director/Supervisor;

· Ensure contracted and billable hours are entered as your scheduled and completed on Lumary accordance with funding sources, designated amounts and in a timely manner provided by supervisor;

· Produces progress reports and treatment plans to meet the requirements and submission timelines of regulatory agencies and funding sources in a timely manner.

Supervision:

· Meet supervision requirements in accordance with BACB standards

· Meet supervision requirements of all insurance and third-party payers

· Help oversee and provide training of new employees and the ongoing training of all staff

· Conduct staff evaluations with Clinical Supervisor or Director are not present

· Conduct staff competency checks as needed

· Cover daily Center Manager duties if Center Manager is absent

· Work collaboratively with Human Resources regarding any employee issues when Supervisor/Director is not present

NON-ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

The employee is required to participate in special projects as assigned. Follow all company policies and procedures in carrying out regular duties. The employee is expected to attend and participate in company meetings and making recommendations for improved processes. PERFORM OTHER SIMILAR AND RELATED DUTIES AS ASSIGNED.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The employee must:
(a) be able to adhere to assigned work schedule with minimal to no deviations as our client’s depend on them.

(b) have reliable transportation, a valid driver’s license, and auto insurance.

(c) pass and be able to maintain compliance with DCF background check requirements.

(d) Complete and maintain all required certifications and trainings during the course of employment.

(e) maintain a clean, safe, organized work and therapy environment.

(f) maintain a professional appearance with regard to grooming, and clothing.

(g) ensure the protection of client information and adhere to HIPAA privacy laws.

The employee must be able to relate to other people beyond giving and receiving instructions:

(a) Can get along with clients, parents, co-workers, peers and supervisors without exhibiting behavioral extremes.

(b) Perform work activities requiring negotiating, instructing, persuading or speaking with others.

(c) Respond appropriately to criticism from supervisor.

(d) Be willing to accept and apply feedback appropriately.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

(a) While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear.

(b) The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms.

(c) Must be able to sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time.

(d) The employee is frequently required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.

(e) The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

(f) Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, and color vision.

(g) Must be physically present at the assigned job location, which may include home, school, and community placements.

Language Skills

(a) Ability to read, analyze, and interpret plans, documents, procedures including clinical protocols and treatment plans.

(b) Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from clients, parents and supervisors.

(c) Ability to communicate thoughts clearly via phone, written correspondence and in person.

Organizational Skills

(a) Ability to be very proactive and detailed oriented.

(b) Ability to follow-through on tasks.

(c) Ability to effectively work on and prioritize multiple tasks.

Reasoning Ability

(a) Engage in analysis of one’s own behavior and seek opportunities for the development and refinement of clinical/professional skills.

(b) Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.

(c) Ability to make reasonable decisions while performing position responsibilities.

Rate of Pay

Salary range dependent on years of experience and expertise. Salary range $67,910-$82,960. Part-time $45-65 per hour. Telehealth options also available. Average caseload 8-12 for full time.

This description documents the general nature and level of responsibility associated with this position. It is not intended to be a comprehensive list of all activities, duties, and responsibilities required. It is not intended to limit or modify the right of any supervisor to assign, direct, and monitor the work of employees under supervision.
